New Records: Cleveland Cavaliers extended their win streak to 11 despite Donovan Mitchell scoring only 11 points on 3-of-16 shooting.
Jarrett Allen and Evan Mobley combined for 46 points and 22 rebounds.
Oklahoma City Thunder's 15-game win streak was snapped.
Key Match Events: Darius Garland's clutch basket sealed the win for the Cavaliers.
Both teams displayed strong defensive and offensive performances throughout the game.
The Cavaliers' ability to generate open looks against the Thunder's defense was a key factor.
Pre-Game Insights: Both teams entered the game riding double-digit win streaks and were expected to put on a heavyweight tilt.
Post-Match Reflections: Cleveland coach Kenny Atkinson acknowledged the team's performance and dismissed doubts about their capabilities.
Oklahoma City Thunder showed resilience despite foul trouble for key players early in the second half.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was highlighted by high-level technical execution, particularly in the third quarter.
The Cavaliers' second-pass strategy and the Thunder's defensive efforts were noted.
Others: The teams will meet again on Jan. 16 in Oklahoma City.
The game was compared to past NBA Finals teams, indicating its significance.
